questions.question_text: The wind tends to follow the contour lines (isohypses) above the friction layer because
options: A. contour lines are lines that connect points with the same windspeed in the upper air
B. the coriolis force acts perpendicular on a line that connects high and low pressure system
C. the coriolis force tends to balance with the horizontal pressure gradient force
D. the friction of the air with the earth's surface gives the airflow a diversion perpendicular to the gradient force.

questions.question_text: The presence of ice pellets at the surface is evidence that
options: A. a cold front has passed
B. there are thunderstorms in the area
C. a warm front has passed
D. freezing rain occurs at a higher altitude

questions.question_text: What will be the effect on the reading of an altimeter of an aircraft parked on the ground as an active cold front is passing?
options: A. It will first increase then decrease.
C. It will first decrease then increase
D. It will fluctuate up and down by about +/- 50 feet.

questions.question_text: Low level wind shear is likely to be greatest
options: A. at the condensation level when there is no night radiation
B. at the condensation level when there is strong surface friction.
C. at the top of a marked surface-based inversion.
D. at the top of the friction layer.

questions.question_text: The QNH is by definition the value of the?
options: A. Altimeter setting so that the needles indicate zero when the aircraft is on ground at the location for which it is provided.
B. Atmospheric pressure at the level of the ground over flown by the aircraft.
C. Altimeter setting so that the needles of the altimeter indicate the altitude of the location for which it is given.
D. Atmospheric pressure at the sea level of the location for which it is given.
